An **ancient naga**, N, is a type of monster that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). It is a multi-headed [naga](/index.php?title=Naga_\(monster_class\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Naga (monster class) (page does not exist)") that possesses [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance") and [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance") alongside the usual [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"). Ancient nagas are the only member of their [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") to be [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid") and possess functional arms: this makes them capable of wearing [gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves") along with the [helms](/wiki/Helm "Helm") and [snakeleg](/index.php?title=Snakeleg\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Snakeleg (page does not exist)") [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that other nagas can also wear.

Ancient nagas have four attacks: a weapon attack and an offhand weapon attack, a powerful bearhug, and a [poisonous](/wiki/Poison "Poison") bite attack that occurs each global turn and targets either 5 or 7 adjacent monsters that the naga is hostile towards, depending on the number of heads it has.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 As a polyform](#As_a_polyform)
- [3 Origin](#Origin)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Ancient nagas may generate in small groups, and will not generate in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"). They may also be created when a lawful hostile spellcaster uses the [summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties "Summon nasties") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell").

Ancient nagas are generated wearing a [snakeleg](/index.php?title=Snakeleg\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Snakeleg (page does not exist)") [archaic plate mail](/index.php?title=Archaic_plate_mail\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Archaic plate mail (page does not exist)"), [archaic helms](/index.php?title=Archaic_helms\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Archaic helms (page does not exist)"), and [archaic gauntlets](/index.php?title=Archaic_gauntlets\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Archaic gauntlets (page does not exist)"), along with wielding two [long swords](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") - all items are huge-sized.

## Strategy

Ancient nagas are a fearsome enemy to face in melee due to their 18 [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") and bearhug attack, which can deal up to 80 damage on its own; their stellar effective base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") of -10 also makes them fairly difficult to hit.

### As a polyform

The ancient naga is among the more powerful [polyself](/wiki/Polyself "Polyself") forms available to a player: they have similar anatomy to a [salamander](/wiki/Salamander "Salamander"), allowing them to wear all huge-sized body armor minus boots, and are capable of [twoweaponing](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon"); their two weapon attacks and bearhug allow for very high damage output while the automatic bite attacks can clear away weaker enemies. However, a significant drawback is that the form is too large for standard-sized armor: players looking to use the polyform long term will need to remove their armor before transforming, then use an [upgrade kit](/wiki/Upgrade_kit "Upgrade kit") to resize it all to fit them.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Nāga](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/N%C4%81ga "wikipedia:Nāga")***

The Nāga (feminine "Nagi") are creatures that appear in *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, and are based on a supernatural race of half-human half-serpent beings that originate in the folkloric traditions of many South Asian and Southeast Asian cultures; Nāga have held cultural significance in these cultures over the past two millennia. They can occasionally take human form, and their most common depiction is that of a snake with a human head, which the default tiles of *NetHack* draw from—other iconographic depictions portray them as human from the waist up and snake from the waist down, wholly human with snakes on the heads and necks, or even as common serpents.

Nāgas are also portrayed as having multiple usually-serpentine heads - the ancient naga of dNetHack is based on the various multi-headed interpretations, as their passive bite is flavored as coming from its multiple cobra heads. One notable naga of this type is King Mucalinda, who appears in the Vinaya Sutra and shelters the Buddha from a great storm by covering the Buddha's head with his seven snake heads.

## Encyclopedia entry

The naga is a mystical creature with the body of a snake and the head of a man or woman. They will fiercely protect the territory they consider their own. Some nagas can be forced to serve as guardians by a spellcaster of great power.

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Ancient naga

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
N ancient naga (No tile)
Difficulty 28
Attacks Weapon 4d6 physical, Offhand Weapon 4d6 physical, Bearhug 4d20 physical, Secondary bite 4d8 poison (strength)
N ancient naga (No tile)
Difficulty 28
Attacks

Weapon 4d6 physical, Offhand Weapon 4d6 physical, Bearhug 4d20 physical, Secondary bite 4d8 poison (strength)

Base level 20
Base experience 802
Speed 18
Base AC -10
Base MR 10
Alignment 10 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 3500
Nutritional value 1000
Size huge
Resistances fire, shock, poison, petrification
Resistances conveyed fire, shock, poison, petrification

An ancient naga:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • has a serpent body.
  • has a thick hide.
  • can lay eggs.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
  • normally appears in small groups.

An ancient naga, N, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. It is a multi-headed naga that possesses fire resistance, shock resistance and stoning resistance alongside the usual poison resistance. Ancient nagas are the only member of their monster class to be humanoid and possess functional arms: this makes them capable of wearing gloves along with the helms and snakeleg body armor that other nagas can also wear.

Ancient nagas have four attacks: a weapon attack and an offhand weapon attack, a powerful bearhug, and a poisonous bite attack that occurs each global turn and targets either 5 or 7 adjacent monsters that the naga is hostile towards, depending on the number of heads it has.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
    • 2.1 As a polyform
  • 3 Origin
  • 4 Encyclopedia entry

Generation

Ancient nagas may generate in small groups, and will not generate in Gehennom. They may also be created when a lawful hostile spellcaster uses the summon nasties monster spell.

Ancient nagas are generated wearing a snakeleg archaic plate mail, archaic helms, and archaic gauntlets, along with wielding two long swords - all items are huge-sized.

Strategy

Ancient nagas are a fearsome enemy to face in melee due to their 18 speed and bearhug attack, which can deal up to 80 damage on its own; their stellar effective base AC of -10 also makes them fairly difficult to hit.

As a polyform

The ancient naga is among the more powerful polyself forms available to a player: they have similar anatomy to a salamander, allowing them to wear all huge-sized body armor minus boots, and are capable of twoweaponing; their two weapon attacks and bearhug allow for very high damage output while the automatic bite attacks can clear away weaker enemies. However, a significant drawback is that the form is too large for standard-sized armor: players looking to use the polyform long term will need to remove their armor before transforming, then use an upgrade kit to resize it all to fit them.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Nāga

The Nāga (feminine "Nagi") are creatures that appear in Dungeons & Dragons, and are based on a supernatural race of half-human half-serpent beings that originate in the folkloric traditions of many South Asian and Southeast Asian cultures; Nāga have held cultural significance in these cultures over the past two millennia. They can occasionally take human form, and their most common depiction is that of a snake with a human head, which the default tiles of NetHack draw from—other iconographic depictions portray them as human from the waist up and snake from the waist down, wholly human with snakes on the heads and necks, or even as common serpents.

Nāgas are also portrayed as having multiple usually-serpentine heads - the ancient naga of dNetHack is based on the various multi-headed interpretations, as their passive bite is flavored as coming from its multiple cobra heads. One notable naga of this type is King Mucalinda, who appears in the Vinaya Sutra and shelters the Buddha from a great storm by covering the Buddha's head with his seven snake heads.

Encyclopedia entry

The naga is a mystical creature with the body of a snake and the head of a man or woman. They will fiercely protect the territory they consider their own. Some nagas can be forced to serve as guardians by a spellcaster of great power.

An '''ancient naga''', {{magenta|N}}, is a type of monster that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. It is a multi-headed [[Naga (monster class)|naga]] that possesses [[fire resistance]], [[shock resistance]] and [[stoning resistance]] alongside the usual [[poison resistance]]. Ancient nagas are the only member of their [[monster class]] to be [[humanoid]] and possess functional arms: this makes them capable of wearing [[gloves]] along with the [[helm]]s and [[snakeleg]] [[body armor]] that other nagas can also wear.

Ancient nagas have four attacks: a weapon attack and an offhand weapon attack, a powerful bearhug, and a [[poison]]ous bite attack that occurs each global turn and targets either 5 or 7 adjacent monsters that the naga is hostile towards, depending on the number of heads it has.

==Generation==
Ancient nagas may generate in small groups, and will not generate in [[Gehennom]]. They may also be created when a lawful hostile spellcaster uses the [[summon nasties]] [[monster spell]].

Ancient nagas are generated wearing a [[snakeleg]] [[archaic plate mail]], [[archaic helms]], and [[archaic gauntlets]], along with wielding two [[long sword]]s - all items are huge-sized.

==Strategy==
Ancient nagas are a fearsome enemy to face in melee due to their 18 [[speed]] and bearhug attack, which can deal up to 80 damage on its own; their stellar effective base [[AC]] of -10 also makes them fairly difficult to hit.

===As a polyform===
The ancient naga is among the more powerful [[polyself]] forms available to a player: they have similar anatomy to a [[salamander]], allowing them to wear all huge-sized body armor minus boots, and are capable of [[twoweapon]]ing; their two weapon attacks and bearhug allow for very high damage output while the automatic bite attacks can clear away weaker enemies. However, a significant drawback is that the form is too large for standard-sized armor: players looking to use the polyform long term will need to remove their armor before transforming, then use an [[upgrade kit]] to resize it all to fit them.

==Origin==
{{Wikipedia|Nāga}}
The Nāga (feminine "Nagi") are creatures that appear in ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'', and are based on a supernatural race of half-human half-serpent beings that originate in the folkloric traditions of many South Asian and Southeast Asian cultures; Nāga have held cultural significance in these cultures over the past two millennia. They can occasionally take human form, and their most common depiction is that of a snake with a human head, which the default tiles of ''NetHack'' draw from—other iconographic depictions portray them as human from the waist up and snake from the waist down, wholly human with snakes on the heads and necks, or even as common serpents. 

Nāgas are also portrayed as having multiple usually-serpentine heads - the ancient naga of dNetHack is based on the various multi-headed interpretations, as their passive bite is flavored as coming from its multiple cobra heads. One notable naga of this type is King Mucalinda, who appears in the Vinaya Sutra and shelters the Buddha from a great storm by covering the Buddha's head with his seven snake heads.

==Encyclopedia entry==

The naga is a mystical creature with the body of a snake and the head of a man or woman.  They will fiercely protect the territory they consider their own.  Some nagas can be forced to serve as guardians by a spellcaster of great power.
</poem>}}
